title: MySQLLOG2()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLLOG2()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the base-2 logarithm of 6:
SELECT LOG2(6);

Definition and Usage
The LOG2() function returns the natural logarithm of a number to base-2.
Note:
See also the
LOG()
function.
Syntax
LOG2(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
A number. Must be greater than 0
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the base-2 logarithm of 64:
SELECT LOG2(64);

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLLOG2()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLLOG2()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLLOG2()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
